TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed RelativeSourceMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes the location of the binding source relative to the position of the binding target.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage For [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] information, see [RelativeSource MarkupExtension](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). ## Examples See for examples.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Data.RelativeSourceMode FindAncestor = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Refers to the ancestor in the parent chain of the data-bound element. You can use this to bind to an ancestor of a specific type or its subclasses. This is the mode you use if you want to specify <xref:System.Windows.Data.RelativeSource.AncestorType%2A> and/or <xref:System.Windows.Data.RelativeSource.AncestorLevel%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Data.RelativeSourceMode PreviousData = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Allows you to bind the previous data item (not that control that contains the data item) in the list of data items being displayed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Data.RelativeSourceMode Self = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Refers to the element on which you are setting the binding and allows you to bind one property of that element to another property on the same element.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Data.RelativeSourceMode TemplatedParent = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Refers to the element to which the template (in which the data-bound element exists) is applied. This is similar to setting a and is only applicable if the is within a template.
